activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr.

records.addlTxt: 9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr. appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr. Officer Peter Cronin sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:44PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy Jr. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom video, time limits not waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

08:21 AM Defendant Benjamin Rayshaun Bellamy in court in custody by video with attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz by video.  Alexander David Goulart and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court orders $1000 Signature Bond with conditions: Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Adjourned initial appearance schedulded for July 20, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Not to possess any paraphernalia,
